conclusion: No violation of P4-2;Violation of Art. 10;Not necessary to examine Art. 14+10;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
docname: CASE OF PIERMONT v. FRANCE - [Romanian Translation]
issue: Aliens (Naturalisation and Residence) Act of 3 December 1849, section 7; Act of 29 May 1874 ; Act of 11 July 1979 on the giving of reasons for administrative decisions, sections 1, 3 ; Act of 6 September 1984 ; Aliens (Conditions of Entry and Residence) Ordinance of 2 November 1945 ; Conseil d'Etat, National Immigration Office judgment of 22 October 1975, Recueil Lebon 1975, p. 520 ; Conseil d'Etat, Julbe-Saez judgment of 6 October 1977, Recueil Lebon 1978, p. 900 ; Conseil d'Etat, Perregaux judgment of 13 May 1977, Recueil Lebon 1977, p. 216 ; Treaty of Rome (1957) establishing the European Economic Community, Articles 40 para. 4, 48, 108, 109, 131-136 bis, 226, 227 ; Protocol on the privileges and immunities of the European Communities of 8 April 1965, Articles 6, 8, 9, 10, 11
scl: Tyrer v. the United Kingdom judgment of 25 April 1978, Series A no. 26, pp. 18-19, para. 38;Castells v. Spain judgment of 23 April 1992, Series A no. 236, pp. 22-23, para. 42;pp. 23-24, para. 46
